info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 5 at 10:33PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
At 1033 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Debord, or over Inez, moving northeast at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Inez, Warfield, Add, Beauty, Tomahawk, Pilgrim, Oaklawn Estates, Coalpoint, Wells Chapel, Davella, Hode, Meally, Prince, Calf Creek, Delong, Williamsport, McClure, Milo, Job, and Lovely.
THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County near mile marker 4. Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 1 and 9.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for southeastern and northeastern Kentucky.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT MARTIN AND SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSON COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM EDT
